home.home_info: I'm a Software and Networks Design student with a specialization in backend and mobile development. My passion is building robust applications with Java and Kotlin, with a focus on functionality, security, and user experience.

aboutme.aboutme_text-1: I'm a Developer in training with a focus on Backend (Java, Spring) and Mobile Development (Kotlin, Jetpack Compose). My academic background in Software and Network Design is complemented by a strong self-taught foundation, solidified by my participation in the 6th generation of Oracle Next Education.
aboutme.aboutme_text-2: I've applied my knowledge to personal projects, such as the user interface for MedLink, a health tracking application, and NoteStack, a note-taking application for developers. I am also the author of Orion Protocol, a personal blog where I publish technical content.
aboutme.aboutme_text-3: My professional goal is to specialize in the creation of secure backend systems and scalable mobile applications. My personal interests include soccer and agriculture.

training.training_subtitle-2: Oracle Next Education F2 T7 Back-end

projects.projects_description-1: A web application for real estate property management. Developed with PHP and MySQL, it uses an MVC approach to manage the creation, updating, and deletion of properties
projects.projects_description-2: A text encryption challenge from the Oracle Next Education program. It's a web application built with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript that encrypts and decrypts text using a simple algorithm
projects.projects_description-3: A personal blog on software development and networking. Created and managed with Jekyll, a static site generator. It's a space to document my notes and learnings in web development and networking
projects.projects_description-4: A currency converter application. It utilizes an external API to provide up-to-date exchange rates, demonstrating the handling of HTTP requests and service integration
projects.projects_description-5: A book and author catalog. This project was developed in Java using Spring Data JPA to interact with the Gutenberg API. Data is persisted in a PostgreSQL database
projects.projects_description-6: A project developed in the Oracle Next Education program. It's a RESTful API for a discussion forum, implementing CRUD operations for topics. It handles user authentication using JWT (JSON Web Token), demonstrating the creation of a secure and functional service.
